intro: Sophoclesia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's Sophoclea, is a flowering plant species native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
